meanings.definition: To hesitate or be unwilling to proceed.
meanings.sent1: The child kept baulking at the idea of jumping into the pool.
meanings.sent2: She was baulking at the thought of giving a speech in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was baulking at wearing a silly hat for the party.
meanings.sent4: His fear of heights had him baulking at climbing the tall ladder.
meanings.sent5: The student's baulking at trying new foods made dinner time a challenge.

meanings.definition: To stop short and refuse to go on.
meanings.sent1: The horse suddenly started baulking during the race.
meanings.sent2: The car engine was baulking, making it difficult to drive smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept baulking at the edge of the table, afraid to fall.
meanings.sent4: The old door was baulking, refusing to open easily.
meanings.sent5: The computer program was baulking at processing the large file.

meanings.definition: To refuse to accept or comply with something.
meanings.sent1: The cat was baulking at the new brand of food.
meanings.sent2: He was baulking at the idea of signing the contract without changes.
meanings.sent3: The toddler kept baulking at wearing shoes in the house.
meanings.sent4: The employee was baulking at the new company policy.
meanings.sent5: The team was baulking at the coach's decision to change the strategy.
